doc.after: The species has been bred outside Antarctica at SeaWorld San Diego; more than 20 individuals have hatched there since 1980.[78][79] Considered a flagship species, 55 individuals were counted in captivity in North American zoos and aquaria in 1999.[80] The first emperor penguin was hatched at Laohutan Ocean Park in Dalian in northeastern China in August 2010.[81] In Japan, the species is housed at Port of Nagoya Public Aquarium and Wakayama Adventure World, with successful hatching in the latter place.[82]
